greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to x^2 + 3y^2 = n in positive integers x and y.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000

E. Akhtarkavan, M. F. M. Salleh and O. Sidek, Multiple Descriptions Video Coding Using Coinciding Lattice Vector Quantizer for H.264/AVC and Motion JPEG2000, World Applied Sciences Journal 21 (2): 157-169, 2013. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 11 2013

Mohammad K. Azarian, Diophantine Pair, Problem B-881, Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 37, No. 3, August 1999, pp. 277-278; Solution to Problem B-881, Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 38, No. 2, May 2000, pp. 183-184.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Euler's 6n+1 Theorem
formula: G.f.: (Theta_3(0,x)-1)*(Theta_3(0,x^3)-1)/4 where Theta_3 is a Jacobi theta function. - _Robert Israel_, Apr 03 2017
maple: for y from 1 to floor(sqrt(N/3-1)) do
mathematica: r[z_] := Reduce[x > 0 && y > 0 && x^2 + 3 y^2 == z, {x, y}, Integers]; Table[rz = r[z]; If[rz === False, 0, If[rz[[0]] === Or, Length[rz], 1]], {z, 0, 102}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 23 2012 *)
CoefficientList[gf, x] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 02 2018, after _Robert Israel_ *)
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Feb 28 2004
ext: Definition corrected by _David A. Corneth_, Apr 03 2017
